overview:
Jemima is a management writer, lecturer and consultant. Her first book, “Monkeys with Typewriters: myths and realities of social media at work” was published by Triarchy Press in December 2009.

Jemima co-founded consultancy iKnowHow in 2002 to promote digital technologies at a strategic level within the creative industries. She has worked on strategy for Fulcrum TV, Skillset, CSV Media, RDF Media and Women in Film & Television, and has produced events and workshops for the UK Film Council, Skillset and Pact.

She lectures in leadership and creative entrepreneurship, most recently at Kings College London (MA Creative & Cultural industries) and Cass Business School (MBA).

She is a Fellow of the RSA (and elected London rep on its Fellowship Council), a founding member of creative entrepreneurs’ club, The Hospital, and co-founder of the creative business network, Cass Creatives.
